com.SIMRacingApps.Util

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.SIMRacingApps.Util.Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows you to load a sound file (WAV) and play it.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeffrey Gilliam
    Copyright:
    Copyright (C) 2015 Jeffrey Gilliam
    License:
    Apache License 2.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sound

        public Sound(java.lang.String deviceName,
             java.lang.String filename)
        Constructor. Creates a Sound object. If the device name is not found, it falls back to the default device. The device name can be the mixer number, but be aware that could change if new sound devices are installed. If the filename is not found, no exception is thrown, it just doesn't play anything.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - The Sound device name.
        filename - The path to the audio file to play. Can be a resource in the classpath.

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
        Returns the error message. Returns blank if no error occured.
        Returns:
        The error message.

      • getDuration

        public double getDuration()
        Returns the duration of the clip in seconds down to the microsecond.
        Returns:
        The duration of the clip in seconds.

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        Get the volume for this clip as a percentage of the volume range.
        Returns:
        The volume as a percentage in the range between 0.0f to 1.0f

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(double percentage)
        Set the volume for this clip as a percentage of the volume range.
        Parameters:
        percentage - The percentage in the range of 0.0f to 1.0f

      • setBalance

        public void setBalance(double percentage)
        Sets the balance position as a percentage of left to right. .5 is centered. Note: If the source file is mono, you cannot change the balance. Convert it to stereo.
        Parameters:
        percentage - The balance position as a percentage between 0.0 to 1.0.

      • play

        public void play()
        Starts the sound playing in the background.

      • setMinTimeBetweenPlays

        public void setMinTimeBetweenPlays(long milliseconds)
        Sets the minimum time between plays in milliseconds
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - Number of milliseconds to wait. Defaults to zero.

      • loop

        public void loop(int count)
        Plays the sound, count, times in the background. To play it unlimited pass in Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        count - The number of times to play the sound.

      • drain

        public void drain()
        Waits for the sound to stop playing, then returns.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the currently playing sound.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the sound. It will not play again after calling this.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
